metadata.title: CVE-2024-46461 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
VLC media player 3.0.20 and earlier is vulnerable to denial of servicethrough an integer overflow which could be triggered with a maliciouslycrafted mms stream (heap based overflow). If successful, a malicious thirdparty could trigger either a crash of VLC or an arbitrary code executionwith the target user's privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-46461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
libvlccore8 - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-data - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-nox - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-plugin-samba - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vlc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-5ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm4').
